Variables:

  • 1. number of previous preterm births
  • 2. history of spontaneous second trimester loss or preterm birth
  • 3. cervical length (less than 25mm)
  • 4. unsuccessful transvaginal cerclage
  • 5. type of cerclage (transabdominal)

Clinical Advice:

If a woman has three or more previous preterm births, offer a history-indicated cervical cerclage. Else, if a woman has less than three previous preterm births without additional risk factors, cerclage is not recommended.
